title: Accidentally said the N word not HARD R.. (Im black if it helps...)
body: My vocabulary consists of me using the n word a lot... So im worried i might get banned for it i used it in a league game i said "Why are these %%%%%s here" I was talking to my buddy who was in game with me referencing two people who came into our discord..

replies.body:

Can you even be more racist than this? xD
How is this racist in any capacity? If he's black then he's black.
Saying that "it's ok to do this because I'm black" implies that it's not ok if you're not black. That is the definition of discriminating against people of another race.
Have you considered that the conclusion is that maybe context is more important than you'd like to think and the word shouldn't be considered a problem if he's being on the level?

So.. we should be racist in how we apply the rules?

It's racist to say that a certain race is allowed to do something another race isn't. Period.
Have you considered that the argument is that context should be looked at regardless?
So.. you're saying that context should be looked at to enable us to be racist against those who are not black?
You do understand the word is not racist by itself, right?

You are free to have that opinion.

The vast majority of society disagrees with you, in that the vast majority of society believes the sole meaning of the word is a racist meaning.

Then the vast majority of society is populated by a bunch of monumental idiots. What, did you think an appeal to popularity was actually going to work on me? The majority of any society supporting their own oppression does not make oppressing them right.

I don't think Rujitra was using _argumentum ad populum_, because how many people feel a thing and how intensely they feel it is very much relevant when it comes to code switching, which is what we're really discussing here. The rules of a place are what the people who occupy that space make of them. I wouldn't go so far as to say people feel the sole meaning of the word is racist, but I would say that most people feel it's too fraught for public usage. Again, that's a code-switching thing.

And no, doesn't matter what race/sex/religion you are, no one is permitted to use offensive slurs. Even if it was unintended. Context does not matter.

As in: it doesn't matter if OP is black or not.

The double standard of "it's ok if a black person says it" just needs to die already. It's either ok (period) or it's not (period).
Have you considered that the argument is that context should be looked at regardless?

How is this for context.  I am among my white friends and family and we are calling each other the word that shall not be mentioned.  A black man from the ghetto happens to be passing by and overhears us.  Is he going to take the context of the situation?  We aren't in any way degrading or insulting anyone of a different race but I guarantee he will take offense to it.  Now how is it ok for that same black man to walk up to his friends and say it multiple times per sentence every single day of his existence?  Where is the equality here?
If he doesn't "take the context of the situation" and notice that none of you are actually black then that is his problem and not yours.

Context does not matter to companies like Riot or Facebook. I wish it weren't so, but it is. Like any company they have to do whatever is safe and if that means turning the community into ResetEra then it's what Riot will do even if it's absolutely stifling.
It wasn't Riot who decided this, it was the community. The vast majority of players do not think toxicity should be permitted regardless of context.
It's not toxic based on the context, though. That's the point. Do you really want the community to become ResetEra?

It is toxic, period. It does not change the word used. The word used is a racist word. Period.

Self control and respect and tolerance of others are expected by society. I'm sorry you didn't learn this in school.

There appears to be a problem with the community, but it's not with the "toxic" players. It appears to be with people who know how to game the system.

No, it's still a problem with "toxic" players who lacks basic self control.  You don't get to claim "triggered" and flamed at every little things that don't go the way you want and then turn around and blame on other people.

The problem isn't just the person retaliating being reprimanded. It's the person who started shit in the first place getting off scot free. This is a phenomenon that use to happen on NeoGAF and probably happens on ResetEra that made it hell for users to express themselves.

> It's the person who started shit in the first place getting off scot free.

You don't know that.  No one knows that...

For starter, you don't always get notification of someone else's punishment.  Secondly, you do not know anyone account's toxic history so you don't know if their punishment is even warranted or if they simply got chat restricted or not.  And thirdly, unless you experienced it yourself, you also only have a 1-sided story when reading this board whether the other people really did started anything to begin with.

With all the people whining about "toxicity" resembling what you'd see on NeoGAF I'm more inclined to believe the people complaining about this on the forums than anyone else especially with how wonky and sporadic reporting is. Hell, I'm pretty sure I'll get some kind of warning or temp ban just for defending this guy. When that happens will you believe that the problem is the system and not the "toxicity"?
No need to go pre-defensive.  You did not break any board rules.  I don't have the slightest clue what is a NeoGAF so your reference is falling on deaf ears.

Oh I'm sure that's not what the "community" thinks. All it takes is for me to stand my ground for long enough before the mods do something regardless of whether or not I actually broke any forum rules. Mods are like police officers in mentality where they're just looking for an excuse to abuse power. Why would I believe that's any different in a community where people will unironically tell me that context doesn't matter?

Do you have any proof of this or we're still in pre-defensive mode?  I'll repeat myself.  None of your post violate any board rules so there's no reason to think the mods will do anything even if reported.  Why the need to already go defensive when none of your posts are actionable?
Call it a hunch based on my experience with innumerable communities of people who think just like you with mods more than happy to abuse their powers.

Yeah, and then everyone will start using it racially and say, "I'm black I shouldn't be punished for it." You don't have a webcam so it's not like we can really tell. Also, I really wish the word would just die off already. I'm not sure why it's used so much when it's rooted in hate. I don't see many Jewish people going around calling each other offensive slur words lol.
The word is never going to die and kicking up a fuss about it every time it's used just ensures it has power. Way to be the very thing you are fighting against.
